training_data.label: COVID_Pneumonia
training_data.description: COVID pneumonia is a lung infection caused by SARS CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19. It causes fluid and inflammation in your lungs.
training_data.suggestion: Submit the assessment to your doctor through the app or by downloading it if you experience symptoms like fever, cough, or breathing difficulties, or if you've had close contact with someone with COVID-19.
training_data.common_symptoms: Dizziness, extreme, fatigue, fever or very tired, sore throat, difficulty with breathing
symptoms: blueish lips skin or nails cyanosis

training_data.label: AA_Amyloidosis
training_data.description: AA amyloidosis, or secondary amyloidosis, is one type of the rare disorder amyloidosis. This disorder happens when proteins in your body mutate, changing form and gathering on your organs and tissues.
training_data.suggestion: Download the assessment and reach out to your doctor to explore treatment options.
training_data.common_symptoms: Swollen feet or legs,  foamy frothy pee, chronic diarrhea, low blood pressure

training_data.label: Alpers_Disease
training_data.suggestion: Please obtain the assessment and reach out to your physician to explore potential treatment options.
training_data.description: Alpers disease is a rare genetic disorder that leads to dementia, liver failure and seizures. Symptoms usually start between ages 2 and 4 or ages 17 and 24.
training_data.common_symptoms: Anxiety and depression, brain disease (encephalopathy),  (hypoglycemia) low blood sugar, lack of growth, migraine headaches and hallucinations
symptoms: loss of controll over arms and legs

training_data.label: Allergies
training_data.suggestion: If symptoms worsen beyond the usual, get in touch with your doctor. You can manage this condition at home using over-the-counter remedies.
training_data.description: Allergies are your body’s reaction to normally harmless substances.
training_data.common_symptoms: sneezing consistently, runny blocked nose, red itchy eyes, sore throat, wheezing or coughing, swelling and hives around the mouth.
symptoms: worsening of asthma or eczema symptoms
itchy all over your body or a specfic part of your body

training_data.label: Abdominal_Aortic_Aneurysm
training_data.suggestion: We advise reaching out to your doctor, providing them with the assessment, and exploring the possibility of undergoing a screening.
training_data.description: An abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) is a bulge in the part of your aorta that runs through your belly.
training_data.common_symptoms: fever, cough headache, low blood pressure, dizziness or fainting, nausea or vommiting
symptoms: severe pain near belly button or lower legs

training_data.label: Aphasia
training_data.description: Aphasia is a brain disorder where a person has trouble speaking or understanding other people speaking.
training_data.suggestion: Contact your doctor with this assessment to determine the potential treatment for the underlying condition.
training_data.common_symptoms: problems with understanding, struggles with repition, loss of fluency, struggling to do basic tasks, low thinking capibilities
symptoms: struggling to do basic tasks with zero complexity

training_data.label: Abdominal_Migraine
training_data.description: Abdominal migraine is a condition that causes episodes of moderate to severe abdominal (belly) pain lasting one to 72 hours.
training_data.suggestion: Contact your doctor with this assessment to determine the potential treatment if lasts more than 72 hours
training_data.common_symptoms: pale like appearance, loss of apetite, vomiting, headache episodes

training_data.label: Aphonia_Loss_of_Voice
training_data.suggestion: This illness is mild and can be self-assessed. If it worsens, consider consulting your doctor and try drinking hot liquids like tea.
training_data.description: Inability to speak clearly low tone.
training_data.common_symptoms: loss of voice, low tone unable to be heard, dry raspy throat feeling
symptoms: low tone unable to be heard

training_data.label: Alzheimer's_Disease
training_data.description: Alzheimer’s disease causes a decline in memory, thinking, learning and organizing skills over time.
training_data.suggestions: Monitor the illness keep contact with your doctor and try exercises to help fix which symptoms are prevalent
training_data.common_symptoms: loss of memory, unable to complete specific tasks, zhoning out, loss of speech
symptoms: unable to do certain tasks effectively
zhoning out when asked a question

training_data.label: Biliary_Stricture
training_data.description: Biliary strictures, also called bile duct strictures, occur when the ducts that carry bile from your liver to your small intestine become narrow or blocked.
training_data.suggestion: Contact your doctor with this assessment to determine the potential treatment
training_data.common_symptoms: abdominal pain upper right side, fever and chills, changes in stool color, itchy skin, loss of apetite, nausea and vommiting
symptoms: abdominal pain upper right side, fever and chills, changes in stool poop color gray pale colors, itchy skin, loss of apetite, nausea and vomiting
changes in stool poop color gray pale colors

training_data.label: Bacteremia
training_data.description: Bacteremia is when you have bacteria in your blood
training_data.suggestion: Contact your doctor with this assessment to determine the potential treatment
training_data.common_symptoms: chills, fast heart rate (tachycardia), diarrhea, rapid breathing and hyperventilation

training_data.label: Broken_Ankle
training_data.suggestion: Maintain minimal pressure on the ankle, and consult your doctor for treatment.
training_data.description: Broken ankles, or ankle fractures, are one of the most common causes of ankle pain.
training_data.common_symptoms: sever pain, hurts when touching, bruised or swollen

training_data.label: Broken_Femur
training_data.description: A broken femur is a serious injury that requires immediate medical care. Broken femurs are treated with surgery and physical therapy.
training_data.common_symptoms: severe pain, cannot put weight on injured leg, peices of femur break skin causing bleeding, parts of the thigh are swollen, injured leg is shorter than the uninjured leg.
symptoms: cannot put weight on injured leg
peices of femur break through skin and cause bleeding
parts of the thigh is swollen
injured leg is shorter then uninjured leg

training_data.label: Bloated_Stomache
training_data.suggestion: The duration for it to subside can range from a few hours to a maximum of two days, depending on the amount of liquids or foods consumed.
training_data.description: A bloated stomach feels tight, full and often painful. You might feel bloated even if you don’t have a distended abdomen.
training_data.common_symptoms: full stomach inable to do tasks properly, cramps, hurts when moving, feeling like you are going to throwup, constant runs to the bathroom
symptoms: full stomach inable to partake in tasks properly
stomach hurts when moving after eating a big meal
feeling like you are going to vomit

training_data.label: Sprained_Ankle
training_data.suggestion: To alleviate pressure on the injured ankle, consider wearing a compression sock if you must work or engage in activities. Swelling and discomfort should subside within a few hours.
training_data.description: A sprained ankle is a common injury that occurs when the ankle ligaments are torn or stretched too far, often after a fall, or if you roll or twist your ankle.
training_data.common_symptoms: mild pain when putting pressure on ankle, tender to touch, swelling and bruising, difficulty when walking
symptoms: mild pain  when applying pressure to affected area of the ankle

training_data.label: Common_Cold
training_data.description: The common cold is an infection of your nose, sinuses, throat and windpipe. Colds spread easily, especially within homes, classrooms and workplaces.
training_data.suggestion: If it persists for more than a week or 10 days, get in touch with your doctor to discuss potential treatment options.
training_data.common_symptoms: sneezing and runny nose, nasal congestion, hoarsness coughing, fever, body aches, fatigue, headache, chills
symptoms: stuff nose hard to breath in one side changes to the other side nasal congestion

training_data.label: Flu
training_data.suggestion: Stay in touch with your doctor and follow home remedies, prioritize rest, and avoid outdoor activities.
training_data.description: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses that infect the nose, throat, and lungs.
training_data.common_symptoms: fever, headache, severe dry cough, intense pain and fatigue, overheating
